about.summary: Provides useful tools for both users and developers of packages for fitting Bayesian models or working with output from Bayesian models. The primary goals of the package are to: (a) Efficiently convert between many different useful formats of draws (samples) from posterior or prior distributions. (b) Provide consistent methods for operations commonly performed on draws, for example, subsetting, binding, or mutating draws. (c) Provide various summaries of draws in convenient formats. (d) Provide lightweight implementations of state of the art posterior inference diagnostics. References: Vehtari et al. (2021) <doi:10.1214/20-BA1221>.

Provides useful tools for both users and developers of packages for fitting Bayesian models or working with output from Bayesian models. The primary goals of the package are to: (a) Efficiently convert between many different useful formats of draws (samples) from posterior or prior distributions. (b) Provide consistent methods for operations commonly performed on draws, for example, subsetting, binding, or mutating draws. (c) Provide various summaries of draws in convenient formats. (d) Provide lightweight implementations of state of the art posterior inference diagnostics. References: Vehtari et al. (2021) <doi:10.1214/20-BA1221>.

name: r-posterior
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.6.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-posterior
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/posterior_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/posterior/posterior_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e507d7bd3f4c9f542cb2ec89bc38d01bd05f9864461533fe4ba8bb8a9e7ba799

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-abind
    - r-checkmate
    - r-distributional
    - r-matrixstats
    - r-pillar
    - r-rlang >=0.4.7
    - r-tensora
    - r-tibble >=3.0.0
    - r-vctrs
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-abind
    - r-checkmate
    - r-distributional
    - r-matrixstats
    - r-pillar
    - r-rlang >=0.4.7
    - r-tensora
    - r-tibble >=3.0.0
    - r-vctrs

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('posterior')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('posterior')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://mc-stan.org/posterior/, https://discourse.mc-stan.org/
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  summary: 'Provides useful tools for both users and developers of packages for fitting Bayesian models or working with output from Bayesian models. The primary goals of the package are to: (a) Efficiently convert between many different useful formats of draws (samples) from posterior or prior distributions. (b) Provide
    consistent methods for operations commonly performed on draws, for example, subsetting, binding, or mutating draws. (c) Provide various summaries of draws in convenient formats. (d) Provide lightweight implementations of state of the art posterior inference diagnostics. References: Vehtari et al. (2021) <doi:10.1214/20-BA1221>.'
  license_family: BSD
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/BSD_3_clause
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: posterior
# Title: Tools for Working with Posterior Distributions
# Version: 1.0.1
# Date: 2021-07-14
# Authors@R: c(person("Paul-Christian", "Burkner", email = "paul.buerkner@gmail.com", role = c("aut", "cre")), person("Jonah", "Gabry", email = "jsg2201@columbia.edu", role = c("aut")), person("Matthew", "Kay", email = "mjskay@umich.edu", role = c("aut")), person("Aki", "Vehtari", email = "Aki.Vehtari@aalto.fi", role = c("aut")), person("Mans", "Magnusson", role = c("ctb")), person("Rok", "Cesnovar", role = c("ctb")), person("Ben", "Lambert", role = c("ctb")), person("Ozan", "Adguzel", role = c("ctb")), person("Jacob", "Socolar", role = c("ctb")))
# Description: Provides useful tools for both users and developers of packages for fitting Bayesian models or working with output from Bayesian models. The primary goals of the package are to: (a) Efficiently convert between many different useful formats of draws (samples) from posterior or prior distributions. (b) Provide consistent methods for operations commonly performed on draws, for example, subsetting, binding, or mutating draws. (c) Provide various summaries of draws in convenient formats. (d) Provide lightweight implementations of state of the art posterior inference diagnostics. References: Vehtari et al. (2021) <doi:10.1214/20-BA1221>.
# Depends: R (>= 3.2.0)
# Imports: abind, checkmate, rlang (>= 0.4.7), stats, tibble (>= 3.0.0), vctrs, tensorA, pillar, distributional, parallel
# Suggests: testthat (>= 2.1.0), caret (>= 6.0.84), gbm (>= 2.1.8), randomForest (>= 4.6.14), e1071 (>= 1.7.3), dplyr, tidyr, knitr, rmarkdown
# License: BSD_3_clause + file LICENSE
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: false
# URL: https://mc-stan.org/posterior/, https://discourse.mc-stan.org/
# BugReports: https://github.com/stan-dev/posterior/issues
# RoxygenNote: 7.1.1
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2021-07-14 10:42:58 UTC; paulb
# Author: Paul-Christian Burkner [aut, cre], Jonah Gabry [aut], Matthew Kay [aut], Aki Vehtari [aut], Mans Magnusson [ctb], Rok Cesnovar [ctb], Ben Lambert [ctb], Ozan Adguzel [ctb], Jacob Socolar [ctb]
# Maintainer: Paul-Christian Burkner <paul.buerkner@gmail.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2021-07-14 12:30:04 UTC
